column1: [1] was an American website for teenage girls that was online from 1996 to 2018, created by Rebecca Odes and others. As one of the first major websites aimed at teenage girls in the United States, [1] was heavily associated with [2] culture and [3]-wave feminism; it was also used in academia to study the online behavior of teenage girls.
column5: it was formerly stylized as gURL.com from 1996 to 2011

column1: [1] [1] is an underground feminist punk movement that began during the early 1990s within the United States in Olympia, Washington and the greater Pacific Northwest and has expanded to many other countries. Riot grrrl is a subcultural movement that combines feminism, punk music, and politics.
Feminism is often divided into three main traditions called [1], [2] and [3] feminism, sometimes known as the "Big Three" schools of feminist thought.
column5: Since the late 20th century, many newer forms of feminism have emerged. Some forms have been criticized as taking into account only white, middle class, college-educated, heterosexual, or cisgender perspectives. These criticisms have led to the creation of ethnically specific or multicultural forms of feminism, such as black feminism and intersectional feminism.

column1: Some feminists have argued that feminism often promotes [1] and the elevation of women's interests above men's, and criticize radical feminist positions as harmful to both men and women.
